title: Doctar
filename: 156 - The Curse of Davros - Jonathan Morris_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
OPENING THEME
SCENE 1. EXT. STREET/BUS/STREET.
(FX: CHUCKING OUT TIME AT A NIGHTCLUB. LAUGHTER, LOW THUMP OF
MUSIC, NIGHT TRAFFIC, ‘MINICAB!’ TOUTS, CLICK OF HIGH-HEELS )
(CHASING AFTER HER) Flip. Flip! What have I done wrong this time?
It’s not you, Jared. I’ve just had enough.
Had enough of what?
Of this. Going to some dodgy club, catching the night bus home. It’s what we always do.
Well, we’ve missed it anyway. The bus went five minutes ago.
So what do we now? I’m not paying for a taxi.
Then we’ll just have to walk it.
In these shoes? Are you trying to be funny?
Or we wait for the next one.
When’s it due?
(CHECKS TIMETABLE) An hour.
An hour? Jared. I’ve gotta go to work in the morning!
Well, what do you suggest? Hold up, look!
FX: BUS ARRIVING
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 2
They’re running late. Bless you Boris, they’re running late!
Yeah, lucky escape for you.
FX: BUS HALTS, DOORS HISS OPEN
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 3
SCENE 2. INT. BUS.
FX: THE BUS IS MOVING
So if you don’t want to do this, what do you want to do?
I don’t know... I just wish something interesting would happen to me for once.
FX: SPACESHIP ROARS OVERHEAD WITH AN INCREDIBLY LOUD ROAR
What the hell was that?
A flying saucer flies overhead and you ask what was that? I
think it was in trouble. It looked like it was on fire.
And the rest! Where’d it go?
Look, you can see there’s a kind of smoke trail in the sky. It
was heading east, down towards the old packing factory.
But there’s nothing there, just wasteground — oh my [God!]
FX: DISTANT EXPLOSION
Which is kind of lucky, considering it’s just crashed.
Yeah. (THINKS) Oh no. Oh no.
What is it?
My mobile, I could’ve taken a photo! Flip, what are you doing?
FX: FLIP DINGS BELL
What does it look like? I’m getting off.
What?
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 4
FX: BUS SLOWS
Jared, a space ship’s just crashed right in front of us, if you think I’m gonna just sit here you’ve got another think coming.
FX: BUS STOPS
Wait! I’m coming with.
FX: DOORS HISS. THEY GET OFF
Look, you can see there’s a sort of glow where it came down. It must still be on fire. Somebody might need our help.
What can we do? You did one first aid course and you said it made you feel sick. Shouldn’t we just leave it to the experts?
FX: BUS PULLS OFF
Suit yourself, I’11l go on my own.
But on second thoughts, a photo of a spaceship, might be able to sell it to the papers, make a few quid.
Come on then. (BEAT) Hang on, stupid shoes. Ow!
FX: SHE THROWS HER SHOES AWAY
Been killing me all night. Right. If we cut across the common,
that’s probably the most direct route.
If you say so. Bit dark though, isn’t it?
Then give us your mobile, we can use its light...
FX: THEY MAKE THEIR WAY ACROSS PARK
FADE OUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 5
SCENE 3. EXT. PARK.
FADE UP
FX: THEY'RE HEADING THROUGH PARK. FLIP WINCING
You alright, Flip? Feet not hurting?
Yeah, it’s just further than I thought. What are you doing?
Trying to get a photo. No good. There’s trees all in the way.
Then we’ll have to get closer, won’t we?
FX: POLICE SIRENS IN THE DISTANCE
Blimey, they didn’t hang about, did they?
FX: DISTANT MILITARY SHOUTS, RUMBLE OF TRUCKS
Not just the Old Bill, look, there’s a whole load of army
trucks. Looks seriously heavy-duty.
Yeah. There’s no way we’re gonna get to it now.
Oh well, that’s that then, we’ve had a bit of a laugh —
(SEES SOMETHING) Jared!
FX: THEY APPROACH SOMETHING HISSING WITH STEAM
What is it?
Something else has come down.
What is it? Some sort of coffin?
It’s not a coffin, you muppet. It’s an escape capsule.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 6
What? You mean it came out of that flying saucer?
Well, duh! And it hasn’t got any lights on it, so nobody would’ve seen it on the way down.
FX: THEY MOVE NEARER, HISSING GETTING LOUDER
Are you sure about this?
What, are you scared?
No, I’m just thinking, there might an alien in there.
Well then you’d better make sure you’re ready to get a photo of it, hadn’t you?
FX: ESCAPE CAPSULE OPENS WITH HYDRAULIC WHOOSH
(SURPRISED) Woah!
Flip! Flip? Are you alright? What is it?
God, Jared, keep your pants on. Shine the light down here.
(TALKING IN SLEEP) No... no... you cannot do this to me...
Oh. My. God. I don’t believe it.
What?
Jared... it’s the Doctor!
No way. The same guy we met last year? Small universe.
(WAKING, WEAK) Help me. You must help me.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 7
Doctor, it’s me. Flip. Remember?
You know who I am? You are an acquaintance of mine?
Don’t worry about it. All you need know is that you can trust me. Here, give me your hand.
SHE HELPS HIM UP
Flip, what are you doing?
What does it look like? I’m getting him out. Doctor, you think you can walk?
Yes... I am able to walk.
Good, lean on my shoulder, that’s it. Whoa!
SHE HELPS DOCTOR UP
But Flip, he’s an alien!
I know that. That’s why I’m taking him home with me.
You’re what?
If that lot get hold of him they’1l stick probes in him to see what he’s made of. Haven’t you seen ET?
Not all the way through. But we don’t know why he’s here. We don’t really know anything about him at all.
I know he’s the Doctor, that’s good enough for me.
The girl is correct. You must get me away from here. Before I am discovered by the authorities.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 8
So, Jared, are you going to help me get him home or not?
Alright, alright. Here, mate,
(FX: THEY HELP THE DOCTOR UP,
You know, Flip.
What?
This is so typical of you.
FADE OUT
give us your other arm.
THEY HEAD AWAY FROM THE SIRENS)
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 9
SCENE 4. INT. FLIP’S HALLWAY/SPARE BEDROOM.
FADE UP: FLIP IS ON THE PHONE
(PRETENDING TO BE ILL)
Yeah... Some sort of throat infection. My glands are all swelled
up like baby tomatoes. I’m on antibiotics... Okay, thanks.
FX: SHE HANGS UP
You’re not going into work?
Well done, Stephen Hawkings. I can’t leave the Doctor alone in
the flat.
Why not? He’s only sleeping.
I want to be here when he wakes up.
I still say we should let the police know. We could give DI Menzies a call, I still have her number somewhere.
That’s for the Doctor to decide, not us.
Suit yourself. Anyway. I’m heading out.
Where are you going?
Dodgy Steve said he might have some work for me.
You don’t want to stick around, for the Doctor?
Can’t, gotta run. Love you babes.
Don’t call me babes, makes you sound like you’re in JLS.
(FX: JARED LEAVES, DOOR SLAMS AFTER HIM. WE MOVE INTO BEDROOM WHERE THE DOCTOR'S HAVING A NIGHTMARE. WE HEAR ECHOED EXCERPT
OF SCENE 56 I.E. A FLASHBACK)
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 10
I had to find out what you were planning, Davros.
So you know of my intentions. That knowledge will not do you
any good. It will not prevent your death!
FX: BACK IN THE BEDROOM WITH THE DOCTOR AS FLIP ENTERS
(TALKING IN SLEEP) You cannot do this to me. You cannot,
Hey, Doctor, it’s alright. You’re safe.
(WAKING) Doctor? (REMEMBERS) Oh yes. Where... Where am I?
You're in my flat, in my spare room.
And you are?
Flip. Philippa Jackson. I rescued you last night.
I remember. But how do you know who I am?
you —
Last year we went to this alien planet and fought these giant
robot mosquitoes.
Mosquitoes?
Terravore.
Yes. Terravore. (CHARMING, PLAYING ALONG) But there was someone
else with you, was there not?
You’re thinking of my boyfriend, Jared.
Jared. Yes. Yes, of course.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 11
Look, can I get but you’1ll have
Just water will
I’1ll go and get were doing with
you anything? A cup of tea? Or I can do toast, to have it without butter.
suffice. I ama little... dehydrated.
it. And then you can tell me what the hell you that flying saucer...
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 12
SCENE 5. EXT. WASTEGROUND.
(FX: MILITARY, SHOUTING ORDERS. VEHICLES DRIVING PAST. SUPERINTENDENT FINCH HAS A STIFF, FORMAL MANNER)
My name is Superintendent Finch. The Sergeant tells me you have some information for us.
Yeah, that’s right. That thing that came down last night, that wasn’t all of it. There was an escape capsule. I can show you.
Was the escape capsule occupied? Answer!
Yeah, there was a bloke inside it. Guy called the Doctor.
The Doctor? You have located the Doctor?
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 13
SCENE 6. INT. FLIP’S SPARE BEDROOM.
So go on, then. Tell me what you’re doing here.

I am being hunted by some enemies of mine. They would have exterminated me already, had I not managed to escape by stealing one of their ships. But as I was about to make the dimensional jump, they managed to hit the ship with a warp missile, destroying the engines.
Right. Hence the whole crash thing.
What concerns me is that my enemies will have pursued me through time. They are disinclined to give up the chase.
No?
And when they fail to discover my body in the wreckage of the ship, they will certainly come looking for me.
Oh. Right.
You cannot tell anybody I am here. (BEAT, SUDDENLY HARSHER) Nobody knows I am here, do they?
Of course not. Well, nobody except for Jared. And he wouldn’t tell anyone. (UNCERTAIN) I’m sure he wouldn’t.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 14
SCENE 7. EXT. WASTEGROUND.
Your ‘girlfriend’ took the Doctor back to her residence?
Yeah. She was worried that you might want to stick probes in him, but you probably know the Doctor better than we do, right?
You have made the correct decision. The Doctor is well known to us. What is the exact location of this residence?
Thamesmead Flats, Number Fifty-One.
Thank you, Jared Rahman. You have done your duty.
No problem, mate, you’re welcome. No chance of a reward is there?
A reward? No. But before you go, there is one more thing you can do...
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by
SCENE 8. INT. FLIP’S KITCHEN.
We have to move. It is not safe
for too long.
But no-one knows you’re here.
Jonathan Morris Page 15
for me to remain in one place
They have other ways of locating me, given time.
‘They’?
The Daleks.
The ‘Daleks’?
Tell me, how long has it been since you found me?
It’s just gone eleven, so about
ten hours.
Then they will already be on Earth.
Okay. Now you’re scaring me.
Good. You should be scared. We have to leave. Now.
‘We’? You want me to come with you?
You can stay if you wish. But if the Daleks believe you have had any contact with me, they will kill you.
Remind me never to ask for an exciting life ever again.
FX: KEY IN DOOR, NOT OPENING
Who is that?
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 16
Must be Jared. He’s always having trouble with his key. Wait here, I'll let him in.
FX: WE MOVE TO THE HALLWAY. SHE OPENS THE DOOR
Jared, I thought you said you were meeting Dodgy Steve.
(HAS EDGE TO HIS VOICE, HOSTILE, ANXIOUS, BITTER) Philippa Jackson?
What?
Identify. You are Philippa Jackson?
I know I am, I’ve got it written on a name badge and everything. Are you alright, Jared ? You look like you’ve got a fever.
Where is the Doctor?
He’s in the kitchen. (CALLS) Doctor, I was right, it’s only Jared.
FX: WE MOVE TO THE KITCHEN
You must be Flip’s ‘boyfriend’, the one who helped me last
night.
You are the Doctor?
Of course he is, you gone stupid or something?
The Doctor is an enemy of the Daleks. He must be exterminated.
What?
Jared, what’s got into you?
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 17
(INCREASING HYSTERIA) Exterminate. Exterminate. Exterminate!
I think I know what has got into him.. Look out, girl!!!
What’s that, an egg-whisk?
FX: DALEK EXTERMINATION EFFECT, FOLLOWED BY EXPLOSION
Okay, not an egg-whisk.
Quick, over here! Unless you want to die!
FX: DOCTOR OVERTURNS TABLE
Exterminate!
(FX: DALEK GUN FIRES. FLIP AND DOCTOR LEAVE KITCHEN, SLAMMING DOOR AFTER THEM)
He blew up my cooker! With a laser beam! What’s going on?
There is no time to explain, we have to get out of here!
Alright, alright! I don’t need telling twice!
FX: THEY LEAVE FLAT, JARED FIRING AFTER THEM
FADE OUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 18
SCENE 9. EXT. FLATS.
FADE UP
(FX: DOCTOR AND FLIP RUNNING OUT OF BUILDING, JARED CHASING AND FIRING DALEK GUN AFTER THEM. HE THROWS OPEN DOORS)
The Doctor must be exterminated!
FX: GUN FIRES, EXPLOSIONS
Oh my G[od] — (ANGRY) That was my flat!
It is not important.
My flat just exploded and you say it’s not important!
You were using a combustible gas as fuel, what did you expect? Listen to me. Do you have a vehicle?
A car, you mean? No, I never passed my test.
Then we have no choice. We have to run! Run!
FX: BACK TO JARED, FIRING GUN AFTER THEM WHILST RUNNING
The Doctor must be exterminated!
FADE OUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 19
SCENE 10. EXT. STREET.
FADE UP
(FX: DOCTOR AND FLIP RUNNING TOWARDS US. JARED FIRING IN DISTANCE, GETTING FURTHER AWAY)
Quick, Doctor, through here, in the lock-up!
(FX: METAL DOOR OPENED, THEY SLIP INSIDE, DOOR CLOSED. JARED’S FIRING GETS MORE DISTANT THEN STOPS)
Fortunately for us he does not know the area as well as you do.
But Jared was brought up on this estate.
(SOFTER, MORE CHARMING AGAIN) Yes, but the person who is chasing us is no longer Jared.
Yeah, talk in riddles, Doctor, that’s really helpful.
The Daleks have developed the technology to allow them to exchange their minds with those of other sentient beings.
You mean, Jared’s walking around with a Dalek inside his head?
He has the consciousness of a Dalek, yes.
Then what’s happened to Jared’s mind?
When they transferred the Dalek mind into his body, his mind would have been transferred into that of a Dalek.
You mean he’s still alive? Somewhere?
Yes. On board the Dalek pursuit ship. But trapped in the body of a Dalek.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 20
SCENE 11. EXT. STREET.
FX: JARED RUNS, COMES TO HALT
The humans have escaped. I have failed.
(FX: HE HAS A TELEPATHIC/RADIO LINK TO A DALEK, WHICH HE CAN HEAR IN HIS HEAD, IT HAS ECHO/SHORT WAVE DISTORTION)
(FX: IN HEAD) More mind-exchanged humans will be despatched into the locality. The Doctor must be located!
He is with a human female. Designation Philippa Jackson.
(FX: IN HEAD) Any associate of the Doctor is an enemy of the Daleks. She must be located and exterminated.
I obey.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 21
SCENE 12. EXT. ALLEY.
FX: THEY’RE CREEPING THROUGH BACK ALLEYS
But how did the Daleks manage to find Jared? And how did they know he had something to do with you?
I imagine he tried to report my presence to the authorities.
Oh, yeah. He did say he we should tell the police... That’s Jared for you. Never listens to a word I say.
The Daleks will be sending more mind-exchanged humans into the area.
You mean, more people walking around with Dalek brains?
Yes. I expect they have gained control of all the civil and military authorities by now.
Oh great. So we’re on our own, then?
(SNAPS) Unless you know of anyone else we can turn to?
No. We’re going to need money, though. I’ve only got about five quid. All my cards and stuff were in my flat, and — and Jared -
BREAKS DOWN
(CHARMING AGAIN) I am sorry, my dear, that you had to become involved in this.
(RECOVERS) No, don’t be, it’s not your fault. Oh hell. I suppose I’m going to have to move back in with mum and creepy Nigel.
Or you could come with me.
I thought you’d never ask. So we get out of here, and then what?
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 22
We have to get off this planet because, very soon, the Daleks will start taking human hostages and exterminating them until I give myself up.
Get off this planet? And how do we do that?
The Daleks have my TARDIS, so we have only one option.
Which is?
We have to find the Daleks’ pursuit ship and steal it!
Isn’t that like incredibly dangerous?
Which is why it will be the last thing they would expect us to do.
You know what, Doctor? Sometimes you are utterly brilliant!
FADE OUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 23
SCENE 13. INT. BUS.
FADE UP
(FX: WE HEAR THE BUS APPROACH, THEN INSIDE IT. THE DOCTOR IS REWIRING A MOBILE PHONE)
Hey, I’ve got a phone just like that.
No, this is your phone. I took it from your apartment, I hope you do not mind, but I needed to adapt it for my purposes.
No, that’s okay. So long it still works when you’re done.
I am afraid that is very unlikely.
Oh, well, I was going to upgrade anyway. What are these purposes you need it for, anyway?
To pick up local sub-wave radio signals.
What, like Capital FM?
The Daleks have a command network with the mind-exchanged humans. A form of artificial telepathy.
Oh, right. So we can listen in on what they’re up to? On what they’re thinking to each other?
Precisely, my dear.
FX: VIA THE MOBILE PHONE, JARED AND A DALEK
(FX: VIA PHONE) Dalek designation Rahman reporting to Dalek command.
Jared!
(FX: VIA PHONE) Dalek command receiving.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 24
Woah, what was that?
That is what a Dalek sounds like.
(UNDER PREVIOUS TWO LINES OF DIALOGUE, FX: VIA PHONE)
I have analysed all transport routes. I believe the Doctor and Philippa have evaded capture by taking a metropolitan bus. Designation One hundred and seventy seven.
Hang on. The one seven seven, that’s this bus!
Yes. I knew it would not take them long to find us.
Then we have to get off.
Not just yet...
(FX: DOCTOR ADJUST CONTROLS ON PHONE. IT MAKES A SHRIEKING, WARBLING, HOWL OF FEEDBACK)
Ow, my ears! What are you doing?
Disrupting the Daleks’ sub-wave frequency...
Interference in command network! Locating source! Locating source!
What?
Source of interference located. Plumstead Road. Moving west.
Doctor! They’ve found us!
Of course they have, that was my intention.
What?
FX: DOCTOR ADJUSTS PHONE, WARPING NOISE
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 25
Now they are tracking us, I can triangulate the source of their tracking signal.
You mean the Daleks’ space ship? By trying to find out where we are, they’ve given away where they are?
Exactly. It is to the south-east, at a distance equivalent to half of one of your Earth miles. (CALLING) Driver. Driver! Stop this vehicle!
FX: BUS BELL DINGS
You do it like that. Half a mile, you say?
It will not take us long. We have to get there before they find thAEsS.
FX: BUS BEGINS TO SLOW DOWN
My phone? You’re leaving it behind?
So long as the device remains on this vehicle, the Daleks will assume we are as well.
But isn’t that putting the people on this bus in danger?
My dear, everyone on this planet is in danger unless I can find a way of getting to that Dalek ship.
FX: BUS COMES TO A HALT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 26
SCENE 14. INT. CAR.
FX: FINCH IS DRIVING THROUGH TRAFFIC
Dalek designation Finch reporting to Dalek command. I have located the source of the interference. It is originating from a metropolitan bus. Now in visual range.
(FX: VIA TELEPATHIC NETWORK, LIKE SCENE 11) The Doctor must be on board. If he attempts to leave, he is to be exterminated.
I obey.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 27
SCENE 15. EXT. OUTSIDE SUPERMARKET.
FX: THE DOCTOR AND FLIP RUNNING ALONG
Hey, that’s Freshgoods supermarket. This is where I work!
You work here?
Yeah, on the tills, and sometimes on the cheese counter. But if I go in there now they’1l know I was phoning in sick.
I do not think that will be a problem.
What do you mean? Hey, it’s usually more busy than this -
(GRABBING HER ARM) Flip. Do not go inside.
What? Why?
FX: SUPERMARKET DOORS OPEN
Oh no. What’s happened to them?
The Daleks got here first.
But all the customers... they must’ve just killed them when they were doing their Sunday shopping.
Standard Dalek procedure. Secure the area, neutralise all unnecessary life forms.
FX: SUPERMARKET DOORS CLOSE
What about all the people inside? All the people I work with?
Brian in packing? Angela in the deli? They can’t be dead too?
Unless the Daleks have taken them as hostages, yes.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 28
And all this just cos they came here to find you?
I am aware of that fact.
I know, I’m sorry, I didn’t mean anything by it. So where’s this space ship?
Look directly in front of you.
What?
You see where there is a large empty space, where no vehicles are parked?
Yeah, so?
That is the Dalek pursuit ship, shielded by a prismatic force field.
You’re kidding [me-]
Quick, hide!
(FX: DALEK AND JARED EMERGE FROM SUPERMARKET, SUPERMARKET DOORS OPEN)
Dalek designation Rahman. Report. Has the Doctor been located?
The device he used to interfere with our command network remains active. We have traced it to a vehicle being followed by Dalek designation Finch.
FX: SUPERMARKET DOORS CLOSE AFTER THEM
That was Jared!
With the mind of a Dalek, remember. We must not let him see us.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 29
I’m hardly likely to forget, am I? And what the hell was that thing he was with? Some sort of mobile wheelie-bin?
That, my dear, was a Dalek.
That’s a Dalek? They’re robots?
No. They may look like robots, but they are living creatures. The most ruthless and formidable race of beings the universe has ever known.
Almost sounds like you’re bigging them up.
‘Bigging them [up?’] — (ALARM) Get back under cover!
FX: SUPERMARKET DOORS OPEN
Have you secured the hostages?
Yes. They are held in the food distribution centre. The humans dare not attack while the lives of their fellow creatures are at stake.
Show me.
FX: THEY HEAD INSIDE. SUPERMARKET DOORS CLOSE
Hear that? There’s still some people in there. I’m going in.
FX: FLIP RUNS INSIDE, SUPERMARKET DOORS OPEN AND CLOSE
Philippa, there’s nothing we can — Philippa, wait! Come back!
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 30
SCENE 16. INT. BUS.
FX: FINCH COMMUNICATING TELEPATHICALLY AS IN SCENE 11
Dalek designation Finch reporting to Dalek command.
(FX: IN HEAD) Report!
I have gained access to the metropolitan bus designation one hundred and seventy seven. I have exterminated the vehicle operator and all passengers.
(FX: IN HEAD) Have you located the Doctor and his associate?
They were not present. They must have disembarked before I made visual contact and abandoned the device causing the network interference in order to mislead us.
(FX: IN HEAD) Then they must have known we had detected the device.
Yes. And it has been used to detect the location of our space craft.
(FX: IN HEAD) Then that is where they must be.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 31
SCENE 17. INT. SUPERMARKET.
FX: DOCTOR AND FLIP CREEPING THROUGH AISLES, WHISPERING
Phillipa! What do you think you are doing?
Didn’t you hear? These dodgem cars from space are holding innocent people hostage. We’ve gotta do something.
Such as getting ourselves killed in a futile rescue attempt?
Do you have any better ideas?
FX: SUPERMARKET TANNOY ACTIVATES. WITH A DALEK VOICE
(FX: VIA TANNOY ) Doctor. Philippa Jackson. We know you are here.
What?
(FX: VIA TANNOY) Analysis of past behaviour patterns indicates you will have come here to attempt to rescue the human captives.
Sounds like they know you too well, Doctor.
(FX: VIA TANNOY)
We have brought the human captives to the area designated Deli Counter. If you do not surrender immediately we will begin exterminating them.
Doctor, we’re gonna have to give ourselves up.
Why? So they can exterminate us too?
But if you don’t, they’re gonna kill all those people.
They are going to die whatever we do.
FX: WE MOVE TO DELI COUNTER, WITH DALEKS GLIDING ABOUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 32
Bring the first captive forward.
No! No! Please!
Exterminate!
FX: EXTERMINATION EFFECT
SCREAMS AND DIES
FX: WE MOVE BACK TO FLIP AND THE DOCTOR
I can’t just stand here and watch this. (BEAT) Doctor.
Yes?
You get to the Dalek ship. I’m gonna buy you some time.
But I told you —
I don’t care. Just go!
FX: BACK TO THE DELI COUNTER
Bring the next captive forward.
FX: FLIP STEPS OUT OF HIDING
No. Stop!
FX: DALEK APPROACHES HER
You are Philippa Jackson.
Yeah, what if I am? You got a problem with that?
You are an associate of the Doctor.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris
If you say so.
Answer!
Yes, all right, yes, I
Where is the Doctor?
You think I’m going to
am.
tell you that?
Page 33
If you do not give us the location of the Doctor, you will be
exterminated.
Well, you’ll have to exterminate me then, won’t you? And then
you’1ll never find out.
Unless you give us the location of the Doctor, we shall exterminate the remaining humans. Answer. Answer. Answer!
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 34
SCENE 18. INT. DALEK SHIP ENTRANCE.
(FX: DOCTOR PRESSING BUTTONS ON CONTROL PANEL. DOOR OPENS. DOCTOR ENTERS DALEK SPACE SHIP. DOOR CLOSES AFTER HIM)
Leaving their space ship unguarded. The complacent fools really should know better than to underestimate me!
(FX: DOCTOR CREEPING THROUGH SHIP, OPENS DOORS INTO A NEW CHAMBER. WHERE THE DALEKS ARE STORING THE HUMAN MINDS INSIDE INERT DALEKS — IE. THEY HAVE DALEK VOICES)
There’s someone here. I can hear him.

JARED: The device he used to interfere with our command network remains active. We have traced it to a vehicle being followed by Dalek designation Finch.
FLIP: That was Jared!
DOCTOR: With the mind of a Dalek, remember. We must not let him see us.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 29
FLIP: I’m hardly likely to forget, am I? And what the hell was that thing he was with? Some sort of mobile wheelie-bin?
DOCTOR: That, my dear, was a Dalek.
FLIP: That’s a Dalek? They’re robots?
DOCTOR: No. They may look like robots, but they are living creatures. The most ruthless and formidable race of beings the universe has ever known.
FLIP: Almost sounds like you’re bigging them up.
DOCTOR: ‘Bigging them [up?’] — (ALARM) Get back under cover!
JARED: Have you secured the hostages?
DALEK TWO: Yes. They are held in the food distribution centre. The humans dare not attack while the lives of their fellow creatures are at stake.
JARED: Show me.
FLIP: Hear that? There’s still some people in there. I’m going in.
DOCTOR: Philippa, there’s nothing we can — Philippa, wait! Come back!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 30
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 16. INT. BUS.
FINCH: Dalek designation Finch reporting to Dalek command.
DALEK: (FX: IN HEAD) Report!
FINCH: I have gained access to the metropolitan bus designation one hundred and seventy seven. I have exterminated the vehicle operator and all passengers.
DALEK: (FX: IN HEAD) Have you located the Doctor and his associate?
FINCH: They were not present. They must have disembarked before I made visual contact and abandoned the device causing the network interference in order to mislead us.
DALEK: (FX: IN HEAD) Then they must have known we had detected the device.
FINCH: Yes. And it has been used to detect the location of our space craft.
DALEK: (FX: IN HEAD) Then that is where they must be.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 31
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 17. INT. SUPERMARKET.
DOCTOR: Phillipa! What do you think you are doing?
FLIP: Didn’t you hear? These dodgem cars from space are holding innocent people hostage. We’ve gotta do something.
DOCTOR: Such as getting ourselves killed in a futile rescue attempt?
FLIP: Do you have any better ideas?
DALEK: (FX: VIA TANNOY ) Doctor. Philippa Jackson. We know you are here.
FLIP: What?
DALEK: (FX: VIA TANNOY) Analysis of past behaviour patterns indicates you will have come here to attempt to rescue the human captives.
FLIP: Sounds like they know you too well, Doctor.
DALEK: (FX: VIA TANNOY)
DALEK: We have brought the human captives to the area designated Deli Counter. If you do not surrender immediately we will begin exterminating them.
FLIP: Doctor, we’re gonna have to give ourselves up.
DOCTOR: Why? So they can exterminate us too?
FLIP: But if you don’t, they’re gonna kill all those people.
DOCTOR: They are going to die whatever we do.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 32
DALEK: Bring the first captive forward.
SHOPPER: No! No! Please!
DALEK: Exterminate!
FLIP: I can’t just stand here and watch this. (BEAT) Doctor.
DOCTOR: Yes?
FLIP: You get to the Dalek ship. I’m gonna buy you some time.
DOCTOR: But I told you —
FLIP: I don’t care. Just go!
DALEK: Bring the next captive forward.
FLIP: No. Stop!
DALEK: You are Philippa Jackson.
FLIP: Yeah, what if I am? You got a problem with that?
DALEK: You are an associate of the Doctor.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris
FLIP: If you say so.
DALEK: Answer!
FLIP: Yes, all right, yes, I
DALEK: Where is the Doctor?
FLIP: You think I’m going to
DALEK: am.
DALEK: tell you that?
DALEK: Page 33
DALEK: If you do not give us the location of the Doctor, you will be
DALEK: exterminated.
FLIP: Well, you’ll have to exterminate me then, won’t you? And then
FLIP: you’1ll never find out.
DALEK: Unless you give us the location of the Doctor, we shall exterminate the remaining humans. Answer. Answer. Answer!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 34
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 18. INT. DALEK SHIP ENTRANCE.
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: DOCTOR PRESSING BUTTONS ON CONTROL PANEL. DOOR OPENS. DOCTOR ENTERS DALEK SPACE SHIP. DOOR CLOSES AFTER HIM)
DOCTOR: Leaving their space ship unguarded. The complacent fools really should know better than to underestimate me!
DOCTOR: (FX: DOCTOR CREEPING THROUGH SHIP, OPENS DOORS INTO A NEW CHAMBER. WHERE THE DALEKS ARE STORING THE HUMAN MINDS INSIDE INERT DALEKS — IE. THEY HAVE DALEK VOICES)
JARED DALEK: There’s someone here. I can hear him.
FINCH DALEK: Who are you? You have to help us.
JARED DALEK: Where are we? What has happened to us?
JARED DALEK: (FX: OTHER DALEKS BEGIN TO CHORUS ‘HELP US’ ‘WHERE ARE WE?’ ‘WHY CAN’T I SEE?’ ‘WHAT HAS HAPPENED TO US?’ ‘MOTHER?’ )
DOCTOR: Silence, all of you! Do you wish for me to be discovered?
JARED: Do not move. Do not move!
DOCTOR: So. The Daleks had the intelligence to leave someone on guard.
JARED: Analysis of past behaviour patterns indicated you would attempt to gain access to our ship.
DOCTOR: Listen to me. You do not understand what you are doing.
JARED: I understand, Doctor. You are an enemy of the Daleks. You must be exterminated!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 35
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 19. INT. SUPERMARKET.
DALEK ONE: Dalek designation Rahman reports. He has captured the Doctor
DALEK ONE: attempting to break into the pursuit ship.
FLIP: What? And it was all going so well!
DALEK TWO: Then we have no need of the human captives. Exterminate them.
DALEK ONE: I obey.
FLIP: No, you can’t. You can’t. They’re just innocent people -
FLIP: They weren’t any threat to you!
DALEK ONE: Silence, or we will exterminate you! Now. Move! Move! Move!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 36
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 20. INT. DALEK SHIP CONTROL ROOM.
FLIP: Doctor. They killed all the hostages, they killed them all!
DOCTOR: I know, Philippa. I did everything I could.
FLIP: It’s alright, Doctor, I know it wasn’t your fault.
DALEK: Prepare to exterminate the prisoners.
DALEK: FINCH & JARED & OTHER HUMANS, MALE AND FEMALE: We obey.
DOCTOR: Wait! There is something of vital importance I have to tell you.
DALEK: Speak!
DOCTOR: Contact your Emperor. Tell him you have one of my associates as your prisoner. That way you are assured of my co-operation.
DALEK: You offer us your co-operation?
DOCTOR: The Emperor knows me. He knows that I will do anything to prevent one of my associates being killed. So all you have to do is to threaten her life and I will have no choice but to obey.
FLIP: Thanks. I think.
DALEK: We shall contact the Emperor. Opening trans-temporal command network.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 37
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 21. INT. DAVROS’ CHAMBER.
DALEK THREE: Receiving communication from pursuit ship.
SUPREME DALEK: Begin communication.
DALEK ONE: (THE SAME DALEK AS IN SCENE 20) This is Dalek pursuit ship. We have captured the Doctor and his associate ‘Philippa Jackson’.
SUPREME DALEK: Then you have your orders. They are to be exterminated.
DAVROS: No. Wait!
SUPREME DALEK: Emperor?
DAVROS: I want both the Doctor and the human female kept alive.
SUPREME DALEK: The Doctor is an enemy of the Daleks. We should exterminate him without delay.
DAVROS: No. I will take full responsibility. Have them brought to me at once! (BEAT) It is time we renewed our acquaintance!
DAVROS: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 38

elements.text: PART TWO
OPENING THEME
SCENE 22. INT. DALEK SHIP.
REPRISE OF EPISODE 1, BUT AS HEARD ON DALEK SHIP
I want both the Doctor and the human female kept alive.
The Doctor is an enemy of the Daleks. We should exterminate him without delay.
No. I will take full responsibility. Have them brought to me at once! (BEAT) It is time we renewed our acquaintance!
Dalek pursuit ship. Bring the Doctor and his associate to Dalek command.
We obey.
FX: COMMUNICATION ENDS
Who’s the talking corpse?
Davros. The genius who created the Daleks.
Oh, right.
Place the Doctor and his associate in the containment cell.
I obey. And the mind-exchanged humans?
Re-exchange their minds with those in the containment units. Then exterminate them and eject their remains into space.
You mean, you’re putting their minds back in their heads?
FX: EYESTALK MOVE
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 39
Yes. And then they will die.
Doctor, that means Jared! They’re gonna kill him!
Yes. Wait! Dalek! One of the humans you exchanged minds with is another of my associates.
FX: EYESTALK MOVE
You want us to spare his life?
You heard what your Emperor said - ‘The Doctor and his associates are to be kept alive.’ Your Emperor will be very angry with you if you cause one of my associates to die.
We will permit him to live... for now.
FX: EYESTALK MOVE
When the human Jared Rahman has had his mind returned, place
him the cell with the others.
I obey.
Doctor, what about all the other people they took over?
I am sorry, my dear, but I cannot save all of them...
Now. Move! Move!
FX: DALEK DOORS OPEN, DOCTOR AND FLIP ESCORTED OUT
FADE OUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 40
SCENE 23. INT. DALEK CELL.
FADE UP
FX: DALEKS GIVING COMMANDS OVER TANNOY
(FX: OVER TANNOY ) Engaging main drive. Commencing lift off.
FX: DALEK SHIP RUMBLES. IT TAKES OFF
Oh my lord, I feel like I’ve got an elephant sitting on top of
me...
Do not worry, my dear, it will only be for a few seconds...
FX: RUMBLING CEASES
(FX: OVER TANNOY ) Pursuit ship now beyond planet’s ionosphere. Preparing for
temporal jump to Dalek command time zone.
What does he mean, temporal jump?
FX: DOOR OPENS. JARED STAGGERS IN
Enter. Enter!
FX: DOOR CLOSES
Jared! Jared, are you all right?
My head feels like that time after your mum’s fortieth.
A side-effect of the mind exchange. The effect will pass.
The what?
You swapped minds with a Dalek.
I did what? No, I remember now. I was speaking to this policeman and I... I told him about the Doctor.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 41
It doesn’t matter. Just next time, do as you’re told, okay? So what was it like, being a Dalek?
I couldn’t see anything, and when I tried to move, it was like I was strapped down. And there was this smell, like antiseptic, and this taste in my mouth like I’d just been sick.
Oh god, ugh.
But that wasn’t the worst of it. The worst thing was the pain. It felt like every part of me was on fire. And I felt... disgusted. Revolted. And angry. So angry.
Angry?
Yeah. Like I could scream. You know like when you’re a kid, you have a temper tantrum? It felt like that, but all the time.
FX: HE’S INTERRUPTED BY A DALEK OVER THE TANNOY
(FX: OVER TANNOY )
Commencing countdown to temporal jump. Five. Four. Three. Two.
One -
(OVER THIS) Flip, Jared. I recommend you take a deep breath...
FX: DALEK SHIP MAKES TEMPORAL JUMP WITH SHRIEKING SHUDDER
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 42
SCENE 24. INT. DAVROS’ CHAMBER.
(FX: DALEK HEARTBEAT AS BEFORE, AND ALL SCENES IN THIS CHAMBER FROM NOW ON, BUT QUIETER, SUBLIMINAL)
Dalek pursuit ship re-entering Dalek command time zone.
Excellent. I want the Doctor and the human female brought to me the moment the ship lands.
I obey.
On no account must either of them be harmed, do you understand me? No matter what.
I obey.
So, ‘Doctor’. You’ve found an ‘associate’ to hide behind. The act of a true coward. I should have expected nothing less!
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 43
SCENE 25. INT. DALEK CELL.
We’ve travelled in time?
I would not have thought that would come as a surprise to you. Have you not travelled in time with me before?
Er, no.
Oh, no, of course, sorry, I am getting you confused with someone else. It is so difficult to keep track...
Thanks a lot!
FX: DOCTOR BEGINS TINKERING WITH DOOR MECHANISM
What are you doing?
Accessing the cell door’s electrostatic over-ride. All Dalek space ships have them.
You know an awful lot about these Daleks.
Well, I have encountered them a considerable number of times before. In fact they consider me their greatest enemy. Ah-ha!
FX: DOOR OPENS
Blimey, you did it. You must be some sort of genius.
Precisely. Quick! Before the ship lands.
(FX: THEY HEAD OUT INTO THE CORRIDOR, HUM OF ENGINES/POWER LOUDER HERE. DOOR CLOSES AFTER THEM)
Where are we going?
The waste disposal chute.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris
Sorry, the what chute?
This way. Come along, girl!
(FX: VIA TANNOY) Pursuit ship beginning final descent...
Page 44
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 45
SCENE 26. EXT. COUNTRYSIDE.
(FX: IT’S RAINING HEAVILY, PLUS A THUNDERSTORM, AS THE DALEK SHIP LANDS. THEN THE DOCTOR, JARED AND FLIP WHOOSHING OUT OF THE WASTE CHUTE)
Ow!
Are you unharmed?
Yeah, fortunately I landed on something soft.
Eh? That was my head!
Exactly.
Good, then we have to get out of here before the Daleks realise we have escaped.
Er, you say get out of here, but where is here?
Some sort of cornfield. More to the point, when?
When?
We've travelled in time. That’s why it’s the middle of the night.
There is no time for idle chatter. Come on!
All right. Cor, he’s a bit shirty, isn’t he?
FX: THEY MOVE OFF, INTO THE THUNDER AND RAIN
FADE OUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 46
SCENE 27. INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM.
FADE UP
FX: DOOR OPENS. SUPREME DALEK ENTERS
Emperor!
Why do you dare to interrupt my solitude?
The Dalek pursuit ship reports that the Doctor and his human associates have escaped.
What?
The Doctor managed to access the electrostatic over-ride.
You fools, you should have placed him under Dalek guard! Did you think a door would prove an obstacle to the Doctor’s genius?
We shall investigate. It should be impossible for any non-Dalek to open — [the]
Don’t waste time finding out how he escaped. Just find him!
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 47
SCENE 28. EXT. COUNTRYSIDE.
(FX: DOCTOR, FLIP, JARED RUNNING/TRUDGING THROUGH THE MUD. RAIN WIND AND DISTANT THUNDER)
Alright, we should be safe to rest for a moment.
In a ditch? Great choice, Doctor. Flip, are you alright?
Well, I’m soaked through, freezing cold, my shoes are full of mud, but apart from that, this is a top night out.
There’s some sort of track up ahead... and lights...
(THE BOOTSTEPS OF AN INFANTRY BATTALION MAKING THEIR WAY DOWN THE LANE TOWARDS US. A BAND PLAYS ‘LE VICTOIRE EST A NOUS’ AT 120 BPM. HORSES ALSO SNORT AS THEY DRAG CANNONS BEHIND THEM)
Woah. Soldiers. In some sort of medieval get-up.
That’s not medieval. They’ve got muskets and bayonets, that’s nineteenth century.
Sorry, forgive me for not being Simon Schwarma. Whoa. There must be thousands of them.
Keep your head down!
Don’t look too happy, do they? But then who would, marching in this weather. I like their hats.
(SPOTS THEM) Halt! Who goes there!
Oh, great.
I told you to keep your head down...
FX: SOLDIERS PISTOLS/RIFLES COCKED
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 48
Step forward with your hands up! If you try anything, you will be shot!
Let us shoot them now, they are clearly spies, Captain.
I shall be the judge of that, Corporal Bouvier. Hold the lamp, let me see them. (BEAT) Hmmm. If they are spies then they are not very well disguised!
We’re not spies!
A girl! And a pretty one too. Has one of the Imperial Guards brought along his mistress to give him comfort in the night?
FX: SOLDIERS LAUGH
Yeah, very funny, you’re the next Jimmy Carr.
We are simply civilians, we got.. disorientated in the dark.
Really? I should have thought all civilians would have fled the region hours ago.
Captain Pascal, we should just kill them and go. We’re still a kilometre from Plancenoit, and the men have been marching for twelve hours, without food or rest.
I am well aware of our predicament, Corporal. But three citizens hardly pose a threat to the French army.
(FX: SOLDIERS LAUGH. IN THE B/G, SOLDIERS CONTINUE TO MARCH PAST. THE BAND NOW PLAYING THE MARSEILLES )
Sorry? You’re the French army?
(WARNING) Flip!
How could you not know that? I mean, I’ve heard tell of the backwardness of Walloon peasant folk, but...
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 49
But if you’re French, why are you all speaking English?
Philippa! Be quiet!
I am sorry. I am not. I am speaking French.
No, French is like ‘hong-i-hong-i-hong’. You’re speaking English, just like me.
You just said that in French.
No way. I’m rubbish at French, the school wouldn’t even enter me for the GCSE.
This makes no sense. Why would you believe you are speaking English, when you are not?
Because I am English — (REALISES) Oh. Shouldn’t have said that.
It seems you were right, Corporal. We have spies in our midst! But if this is the best the seventh coalition can muster, we have little to fear!
Shall I have the men run them through, Captain?
No. We shall take them to the encampment at Plancenoit. Let them enjoy some of our famous French hospitality!
FX: SOLDIERS LAUGH AS DOCTOR, FLIP, PASCAL DRAGGED AWAY
FADE OUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 50
SCENE 29. INT. TENT.
FADE UP
(FX: STORM STILL RAGING OUTSIDE. SOLDIERS SHOUTING, TENTS BEING PUT UP, FLAPPING IN THE WIND)
Inside, you lot! Inside!
FX: TENT FLAP PULLED ASIDE, DOCTOR, FLIP, JARED CLAMBER IN
Guard them with your life. I will inform the generals.
FX: TENT FLAP CLOSED, MUFFLING STORM
Great. Now we’ve been captured by the French army. I don’t think I’m ever going to live this down.
Jared, could you do something other than moan for once? This is history, we're in history, and we’re taking part in it. Is there any way in which that isn’t brilliant?
Says the girl who got us caught.
How was I supposed to know I could suddenly speak French?
A Time Lord gift. While you are with me you have the ability to converse in any language.
Pity you didn’t mention that before.
Yeah, it would’ve been handy for my GCSE too.
But where are we? And when?
The French Captain mentioned Walloon, where’s that?
Wallonia, the southern part of Belgium. And as for the date? The early hours of the morning of the eighteenth of June, 1815.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 51
1815? So I was right about nineteenth century? Result.
Sorry, am I being thick, but what are the Daleks, aliens from Space, doing in Belgium in 1815?
Does that date not mean anything to you?
No. Should it?
This is a date where the future of the human race hangs in the balance. The Daleks are determined to change the course of history.
Right. So we’ve gotta stop them!
Cool. You do that. But first there’s the slight problem of being stuck in the middle of the French camp —
FX: TENT FLAP OPENS
You, the mad girl who thinks she speaks English. Out.
Excuse me?
You are to be taken for interrogation.
Hey, listen mate —
Do not worry. Your turn will come soon enough!
FADE OUT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 52
SCENE 30. INT. FARMHOUSE.
FADE UP
FX: FIRE CRACKLES IN HEARTH. KNOCK ON DOOR
Your imperial majesty. I have brought the girl as you
requested.
Bring her in.
FX: DOOR OPENS
Hey, no need to push.
That will be all, Captain.
But the girl, she is a — [spy]
I think I am quite capable of defending myself against an unarmed woman. You may remain outside.
Yes, sire. Vive 1’Empereur!
FX: DOOR CLOSES
The Emperor? You’re the Emperor? No, really?
Please, sit down my dear. Feel free to dry yourself by the fire. I can have fresh clothes brought for you, if you wish?
No, I’m good as I am, thanks. Nice farmhouse you’ve got here.
It serves its purpose. May I offer you some wine?
I thought you wanted to interrogate me, not chat me up? Wow,
you are so French!
FX: HE POURS WINE
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 53
I do wish to ask you a few questions, yes. But there is no need for us to be uncivilised.
I suppose I should be honoured. An Emperor who does his own questioning. You should learn to delegate, mate.
Perhaps I should. May I say, this is rather a novel experience for me too. To meet someone who is not quaking with fear to be in my presence.
Think a lot of yourself, don’t you? Who are you, anyway?
You don’t know who I am?
Er, would I ask if I knew?
My dear. I am the Emperor Bonaparte.
No way! NO WAY!
I can assure you that I am.
You’re not. You can’t be.
And why’s that?
Well, for a start. I thought you were supposed to be a little short guy, with a big hat.
Ha! Next you’ll be asking me why I don’t have my right hand tucked inside my waistcoat!
You really are him, aren’t you? You’re Napoleon!
Now that is interesting, my dear. Because nobody would ever dare call me by that name to my face.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 54
What, Napoleon? But that’s your name!
It may be my name, my dear, but to my citizens I am known as the Emperor Bonaparte. And nothing else.
Sorry. I didn’t mean to disrespect you.
No, of course not, because you didn’t know any better. Tell me, what else do you know of me?
Sorry, what?
My dear, I am the greatest man alive, feted and feared across the globe. So tell me. How do they speak of me, in the future?
Sorry. What?
Don’t play games, my dear. I know you are from another time.
But how could you know that?
Oh, it was not difficult to guess. Your clothes, your manner. And besides, your arrival was not unexpected.
No?
You haven’t answered my question. How am I regarded in the future?
Well, I didn’t really do history. But you introduced the metric system, I do know that, that was good —
And that is all? Nothing else?
Not really, no, sorry.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 55
Let me be more precise. What do you know of Waterloo?
The Battle of Waterloo?
Yes.
(SPOKEN NOT SUNG) Well, um, I know that at Waterloo... Napoleon did surrender.
And who told you that, may I ask?
Abba.
Abba?
They made up a song about it. About you. Coming second.
Well, I can assure you, my dear, that I have no intention of surrendering. That is now a future that will be wiped from the pages of history!
Eh? What are you talking about?
Just as one learns from the past, one may also learn from the future. For I have been promised that this day shall be mine!
Promised by who? Oh. Let me guess.
FX: BONAPARTE ACTIVATES CONCEALED COMMUNICATION DEVICE
Bonaparte calling Dalek command. The three travellers from the future you asked me to find. I have them as my prisoners.
(FX: VIA RADIO) You shall return them to us!
As you desire, my Dalek friend. As you desire!
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 56
SCENE 31. INT. TENT.
FX: FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING THE TENT
Doctor, I think someone’s coming.
Good. You know what to do?
FX: TENT FLAP OPENS
All right you two, outside -
Now!
FX: JARED GRABS BOUVIER
(HIT) Ow!
Take his pistol.
Got it Doctor.
Good. Now give it to me.
FX: GUN HANDED OVER. GUN COCKED
If you imagine you can just stroll out of here, you are very much mistaken, Englishman.
Which is why you are going to help us.
What?
You are going to lead us out of here. As prisoner and escort.
Now move!
FX: THEY HEAD OUTSIDE
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 57
SCENE 32. EXT. ENCAMPMENT.
(FX: BONAPARTE DISCUSSING TACTICS LATE-NIGHT WITH GENERALS. HE WALKS AMONGST BONFIRES, GUNS BEING MOVED. SHOUTS OF ‘VIVE L’EMPEREUR!’ AS SOLDIERS SPOT HIM. HORSES AND PATRIOTIC SONGS)
And so, Emperor, I estimate our reserve forces to number in excess of fifteen thousand muskets and over ninety cannon.
Deploy them between Reille’s second corps to the west, and d’Erlon’s first corps to the east. The art of war, Marshal Ney, is a matter of being prepared for every eventuality.
As your imperial majesty commands. I’m afraid we have yet to ascertain the positions of the allied forces...
Order the artillery to fire along the Mont St Jean ridge. We shall know where they are deployed by where they return fire.
CONCUR. ‘INGENIOUS’, ‘AN EXCELLENT NOTION!’
What concerns me is the Prussian army. If they were to arrive before we have defeated the British... then all would be lost.
But they are miles away, and after their rout at Ligny, they will need two days to recover, if not more...
Nevertheless, I do not wish for there to be any unwelcome surprises. Send a message to Marshal Grouchy to head them off at the town of Wavre. This is of absolute importance.
I shall despatch the message myself, your highness.

Gentlemen! Tell me, do you know what a battle is? Between a battle lost and a battle won runs the whole thread of history. Battles decide the fates of empires, kingdoms, of the world itself. In a few hours, we fight for nothing less than the future of mankind! And tomorrow night, gentlemen, we shall sleep in Brussels!
CHEER.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 58
SCENE 33. EXT. ENCAMPMENT.
(FX: ARTILLERY GUNS BOOM IN THE DISTANCE. RAIN HAS STOPPED. FLIP IS BEING ESCORTED THROUGH FRENCH CAMP)
What’s that?
It sounds to me like the start of battle.
The Battle of Waterloo... (SEES SOMETHING) Doctor! Jared!
FX: BOOTSTEPS AS THEY APPROACH PASCAL, DOCTOR, JARED
Corporal. Halt!
Yes, sir.
Hey, Doctor. You’1ll never believe who I’ve just met!
Philippa, it will have to wait.
But!
Corporal Bouvier. You received the Emperor’s order to transfer the prisoners to the Chateau, I see.
I did, sir.
Then why, may I ask, have you decided to escort them
singlehanded?
I, er.. sir, they overpowered me! And the man, he is — (armed)
FX: GUNSHOT RINGS OUT. BOUVIER IS HIT. GUN COCKED AGAIN
I recommend you let the girl go, Captain.
FX: FLIP IS RELEASED
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 59

BOUVIER: All right you two, outside -
DOCTOR: Now!
BOUVIER: (HIT) Ow!
DOCTOR: Take his pistol.
JARED: Got it Doctor.
DOCTOR: Good. Now give it to me.
BOUVIER: If you imagine you can just stroll out of here, you are very much mistaken, Englishman.
DOCTOR: Which is why you are going to help us.
BOUVIER: What?
DOCTOR: You are going to lead us out of here. As prisoner and escort.
DOCTOR: Now move!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 57
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 32. EXT. ENCAMPMENT.
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: BONAPARTE DISCUSSING TACTICS LATE-NIGHT WITH GENERALS. HE WALKS AMONGST BONFIRES, GUNS BEING MOVED. SHOUTS OF ‘VIVE L’EMPEREUR!’ AS SOLDIERS SPOT HIM. HORSES AND PATRIOTIC SONGS)
NEY: And so, Emperor, I estimate our reserve forces to number in excess of fifteen thousand muskets and over ninety cannon.
BONAPARTE: Deploy them between Reille’s second corps to the west, and d’Erlon’s first corps to the east. The art of war, Marshal Ney, is a matter of being prepared for every eventuality.
NEY: As your imperial majesty commands. I’m afraid we have yet to ascertain the positions of the allied forces...
BONAPARTE: Order the artillery to fire along the Mont St Jean ridge. We shall know where they are deployed by where they return fire.
BONAPARTE: What concerns me is the Prussian army. If they were to arrive before we have defeated the British... then all would be lost.
NEY: But they are miles away, and after their rout at Ligny, they will need two days to recover, if not more...
BONAPARTE: Nevertheless, I do not wish for there to be any unwelcome surprises. Send a message to Marshal Grouchy to head them off at the town of Wavre. This is of absolute importance.
NEY: I shall despatch the message myself, your highness.
BONAPARTE: Gentlemen! Tell me, do you know what a battle is? Between a battle lost and a battle won runs the whole thread of history. Battles decide the fates of empires, kingdoms, of the world itself. In a few hours, we fight for nothing less than the future of mankind! And tomorrow night, gentlemen, we shall sleep in Brussels!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 58
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 33. EXT. ENCAMPMENT.
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: ARTILLERY GUNS BOOM IN THE DISTANCE. RAIN HAS STOPPED. FLIP IS BEING ESCORTED THROUGH FRENCH CAMP)
FLIP: What’s that?
PASCAL: It sounds to me like the start of battle.
FLIP: The Battle of Waterloo... (SEES SOMETHING) Doctor! Jared!
PASCAL: Corporal. Halt!
BOUVIER: Yes, sir.
FLIP: Hey, Doctor. You’1ll never believe who I’ve just met!
DOCTOR: Philippa, it will have to wait.
FLIP: But!
PASCAL: Corporal Bouvier. You received the Emperor’s order to transfer the prisoners to the Chateau, I see.
BOUVIER: I did, sir.
PASCAL: Then why, may I ask, have you decided to escort them
PASCAL: singlehanded?
BOUVIER: I, er.. sir, they overpowered me! And the man, he is — (armed)
DOCTOR: I recommend you let the girl go, Captain.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 59
FLIP: Doctor, the Corporal... I think he’s dead.
DOCTOR: No, I can assure you, he is just stunned.
FLIP: He’s bleeding.
DOCTOR: He will make a full recovery.
FLIP: You’re sure about that? Because he’s not breathing.
DOCTOR: There is no time to argue. We have to move. Or we will all be dead.
PASCAL: You cannot escape. The perimeter guards will have heard the sound of the shot.
DOCTOR: With the cannons of the Grande Batterie ringing in their ears? I think not.
JARED: Er, I think you might be wrong about that, Doctor...
JARED: (FX: SOLDIERS RUNNING TOWARDS THEM, SHOUTING ‘INTRUDERS’, ‘WHO GOES THERE, ‘HALT!’ ETC)
DOCTOR: We will have to leave the road and cut through Hougemont wood. Come on! Run!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 60
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 34. INT. FARMHOUSE/DAVROS’ CONTROL CHAMBER.
BONAPARTE: Bonaparte calling Dalek command. I regret to inform you that the three travellers from the future have escaped.
SUPREME DALEK: (FX: VIA RADIO) You have failed us.
BONAPARTE: You told me this Doctor wasn’t dangerous! Well, before he ran off he shot one of my men. Corporal Bouvier. Who is now dead.
SUPREME DALEK: (FX: VIA RADIO) That is of no concern. You will order your men to locate the Doctor!
BONAPARTE: (FX: VIA RADIO) I have no men to spare, Dalek. Or have you forgotten? I have a battle to fight! They’re your prisoners. You find them!
DAVROS: (AMUSED) If there is one thing humans can be relied upon, it is their unreliability.
SUPREME DALEK: We should exchange the Emperor Bonaparte’s mind with that of a Dalek. Then he would obey.
DAVROS: No. Not yet. In the meantime, assign every spare Dalek to locate the Doctor and his associates.
SUPREME: I obey.
DAVROS: Good. And place a guard on this chamber. Where the Doctor is concerned, we cannot afford to take any chances...
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 61
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 35. EXT. WOODS.
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: DOCTOR, FLIP RUNNING THROUGH MUD. CANNONS IN DISTANCE. MORNING BIRDSONG )
FLIP: Jared! Doctor, we’ve lost Jared!
DOCTOR: What?
FLIP: We'll have to go back for him.
DOCTOR: No. There is no time. He will have to look after himself.
FLIP: What do you mean, there’s no time?
DOCTOR: It is almost dawn. And then it will be too late. Quick! Get down!
FLIP: Why? What is it?
DALEKS: Seek! Locate! Seek! Locate!
FLIP: They’re flying. I didn’t know they could fly. You never said they could fly!
DOCTOR: How else do you think they could traverse this terrain?
FLIP: But anyone might see them!
DOCTOR: No. They are all shielded by a prismatic force field. No-one from this time period will be able to see or hear them.
FLIP: Oh. Right. Like the Dalek space ship!
DOCTOR: Exactly. They are moving away now, this is our chance!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 62
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 36. EXT. WOODS
JARED: (WHISPER) Doctor. Flip. Where are you? Where’d you go? Doctor!
DICKSON: Alright, that’s far enough, you French cur. Step forward with
DICKSON: your hands up!
JARED: Listen, man. Do I sound French? Do I even look French?
DICKSON: No. But that is hardly to be expected from a spy.
JARED: Oh no, not you lot as well.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 63
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 37. EXT. FIELD.
FLIP: Doctor! I forgot to tell you. I met Napoleon. And he’s like best mates with the Daleks.
DOCTOR: Yes. They intend to make sure that he wins the battle.
FLIP: You knew?
DOCTOR: Of course I knew. That is why we have come here.
FLIP: What is it? Some sort of stately home?
DOCTOR: That is the Chateau Rossome.
FLIP: So?
DOCTOR: You will see soon enough. But stay close to me. This is where it gets dangerous.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 64
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 38. INT. FARMHOUSE.
BONAPARTE: (GIVING ORDERS) You! Fetch me more strong coffee, and bread! And you — clear the table, we need space for our maps.
SERVANTS: (MUMBLE) Yes, sire.
NEY: Judging by the response to the bombardment, the Allied army is deployed along the ridge. There are about two kilometres of open field between us. The ground is soaked, our cavalry will not be able to cross it without being cut down.
BONAPARTE: Then we shall wait until the ground is dry. There is no hurry. In choosing to defend Waterloo, the Duke of Wellington has led his army into a trap!
NEY: Nevertheless, the Duke’s reputation —
BONAPARTE: What reputation? Because you’ve all been defeated by Wellington, you consider him a great general. But I tell you that he is a bad general, and defeating him will be as easy as... as having breakfast!
NEY: We've just received word from General Grouchy, your highness. He reports he has secured the town of Wavre. Now there is no way the Prussians can come to the aid of the British.
BONAPARTE: (THOUGHTFUL, TO HIMSELF) In another time, that might have made all the difference.
NEY: Sire?
BONAPARTE: Wellington has rolled the dice and they have landed in our favour. We have ninety chances against his ten. He has no room to manoeuvre, no reinforcements, and no chance of escape. Gentlemen. Today will see the British army’s greatest defeat. They will be wiped from the face of the Earth. Victory is assured!
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 65
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 66
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 39. EXT. CHATEAU.
FLIP: I still don’t get why we’ve come here. When I went to see
FLIP: Napoleon, he was based in a farmhouse.
DOCTOR: And does that not strike you as odd?
FLIP: Odd? How?
DOCTOR: That he would choose to sleep in a lowly farmhouse if he had a chateau at his disposal?
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 67
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 40. INT. CHATEAU (CONTINUOUS)
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: THEY ARE IN A SPACESHIP. DOOR CLOSES WITH ELECTRONIC WHOOSH. METAL FLOOR, ECHO ON VOICE, EERIE DALEK SHIP EFFECTS)
FLIP: It’s a space ship.
DOCTOR: Yes.
FLIP: A space ship disguised as a mansion!
DOCTOR: Not quite. This is, in fact, a French chateau which has been constructed around a Dalek mothership.
FLIP: But that doesn’t make sense. The chateau must be hundreds of years old!
DOCTOR: It’s perfectly simple, [it] — Quiet!
FLIP: What is it?
DOCTOR: Daleks!
FLIP: They look like they’re looking for something.
DOCTOR: They are. Us.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 68
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 41. EXT. WOODS
JARED: Where are you taking me?
DICKSON: Where do you think? To Mont St Jean. Rather than betraying our positions to the French, you will instead betray your own army’s positions to us.
JARED: Really? Because I have no idea.
DICKSON: I hope that is not the case, my French friend. Because that information is the only thing that is keeping you alive.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 69
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 42. INT. CHATEAU.
FLIP: This place is so weird. Half of it’s like a spaceship, the rest is all chandeliers, mirrors and carpets. I mean, what’s this, some sort of ballroom?
DOCTOR: It may be a Dalek mothership, but it is also a chateau.
FLIP: Right, like that makes sense. You seem to know your way round, though. Where are we going?
DOCTOR: You will not have long to wait. (BEAT) We are expected. Two Daleks on guard duty.
FLIP: Well you’re hardly gonna get past them with one pistol.
DOCTOR: No need. Just move aside the tapestry and — yes!
FLIP: What’s that?
DOCTOR: An access point for the mothership’s security computer.
DALEKS: Intruder detected in loading bay. Seek. Locate. Seek! Locate!
FLIP: They've gone!
DOCTOR: Then this is our chance!
DOCTOR: (FX: DOOR WHOOSHES OPEN. THEY ENTER CONTROL CHAMBER. CONTINUOUS
TO NEXT SCENE: )
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 70
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 43. INT. DAVROS’ CHAMBER
FLIP: What is this place?
DOCTOR: The Dalek command centre.
FLIP: Right. Hence all the electrical [gubbins] — (YELPS IN SHOCK)
DAVROS: So. We are reunited at last. It seems I have underestimated you.
DOCTOR: Of course. But then, that is a mistake you keep on making.
DAVROS: You realise, of course, that at any moment I can summon the Daleks and have you exterminated?
DOCTOR: Yes. But if you dare to so much as lift a finger, your friend will die.
FLIP: Sorry, whose friend? What are you talking about?
DAVROS: You are mistaken. The girl is unknown to me.
FLIP: Well, of course I am, we’ve never met.
DOCTOR: An amusing bluff. But it will not be enough to save you.
DOCTOR: The time has come for you to die.
FLIP: But Doctor. You can’t.
DOCTOR: You do not understand, my dear.
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 71
FLIP: Er, I think I do. This guy’s in a wheelchair. He can’t defend himself. You can’t shoot him. I won’t let you.
DOCTOR: Flip, move out of the way. This man must die.
FLIP: No!
DOCTOR: Move out of the way, girl. That is an order!
FLIP: An order? Who do you think you are?
DOCTOR: Who do I think I am? (LAUGHS) Who do you think I am?
FLIP: I don’t know. But you’re not the Doctor. The Doctor would never
FLIP: kill someone in cold blood. Like you killed that Corporal!
DOCTOR: I was wondering how long it would take for you to work it out.
FLIP: What? What do you mean?
DOCTOR: My dear. I am not the Doctor. I am Davros!
FLIP: But if you’re Davros, then who’s the guy in the chair?
DOCTOR: Well? Go on. Tell her. Tell her!
DAVROS: My dear — I am the Doctor!
DAVROS: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 72

elements.text: PART THREE
OPENING THEME
SCENE 44. INT. DAVROS’ CHAMBER.
REPRISE OF EPISODE TWO
I was wondering how long it would take for you to work it out.
What? What do you mean?
My dear. I am not the Doctor. I am Davros!
But if you’re Davros, then who’s the guy in the chair?
Well? Go on. Tell her. Tell her!
My dear — I am the Doctor!
You’re the Doctor? But how.. oh. The Dalek mind-swap thing, right?
Correct, my dear. The Doctor used it to exchange my body with his.
This was the Doctor’s idea? But why?
Well, Doctor? Would you care to answer that?
(LAUGHS) You think I’m going to blurt out my plans just like that? I’m afraid not, Davros. That’s the sort of thing you’d do.
It hardly matters. Now, move out of the way, girl.
Er, no. You’ll have to shoot me.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 73
So be it. I only brought you here as security in the first place.
Security?
The Doctor will do anything to prevent his associates being killed. In order to keep you alive, he had to keep me alive.
No, still don’t get it.
You thought you were his companion, when you were his hostage.
This is your final warning. Move out of the way, or I will not hesitate to kill you.
But if you kill him, you’1ll never get your own body back.
That thing, that withered, rotting husk, that twisted cadaver, that living death? You think I’d want to return to that?
When you put it like that, I suppose not.
Now I have the body of a Time Lord. For the first time in centuries, I have no pain. I am alive, more alive than I have ever been. And it is good.
But if you kill the Doctor, won’t the Daleks kill you? For, you know, murdering their Emperor and stuff?
I will be able to prove my identity with a brain-scan. You see, my brain pattern is not so very different from that of a Dalek.
So that’s why you could open all their doors so easily!
Enough talk. It is time for you to die.
FX: PISTOL COCKED — AND DOOR OPENS
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 74
Halt. Do not move! Do not move!
FX: DALEKS GLIDE INTO THE CHAMBER
Daleks! If the Doctor harms me or the girl, he is to be exterminated at once. You understand me? At once!
We obey.
Now, put the weapon down, Doctor. Or I shall have no choice but to let the Daleks exterminate you.
I warned you, I will kill the girl.
And if you do, you will die.
Daleks. I am not the Doctor. I am Davros, in the Doctor’s body. The Doctor tricked you, he used the mind exchange!
(LAUGHS) A transparent ruse, Doctor. Now. Are you going to put the gun down or not?
FX: THE DOCTOR DROPS THE GUN
Daleks. Take him to the chateau dungeons and lock him up.
We obey.
And leave a Dalek in the cell with him. With orders that if he attempts to escape, he is to be exterminated.
We obey.
Now. You will leave us. I wish to interrogate the human female in private. On no account are we to be disturbed.
FX: DALEKS LEAVE. DOOR CLOSES BEHIND THEM
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 75
Blimey, that was close.
Close?
I mean, if the Daleks hadn’t turned up when they did...
(LAUGHS) The Doctor, rescued by the Daleks. Yes. There is a first time for everything!
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 76
SCENE 45. EXT. MONT ST JEAN.
(FX: DISTANT CANNON FIRE. SOLDIERS CHATTING, READYING CANNONS, BONFIRES, HORSES SNORT. )
How many times do I have to tell you? I’m English. I was born in Plumstead!
Then what were you doing in the woods at Hougemont? You are not a soldier, no part of the allied Army.
It’s a long story, mate, and you wouldn’t believe it. I don’t believe it, and I’m the one it happened to!
You’d do better to tell the truth, if you wish to live.
Alright. Look. Mad as it sounds, I was brought here.
Brought here?
Yeah. By the these things called Daleks.
Sorry, did you say ‘Daleks’?
Yeah. Why-
(ADDRESSING ANOTHER OFFICER) Sergeant Harper! Send word to the Duke. Tell him we’ve found someone who knows about the Daleks!
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 77
SCENE 46. INT. DUNGEONS.
(FX: DALEKS ESCORTING THE DOCTOR INTO DUNGEON CELL. CELL DOOR CLANKS OPEN. DRIPPING WATER. )
Doctor. You will move into the cell. Enter! Enter!
But I am your Emperor! I am Davros!
You lie. You are the Doctor.
Scan my brain, it will — (prove)
The Doctor is not to be trusted. Your intention must be to deceive us.
You paranoid fool. You are so frightened of the Doctor you are blind to reason.
Move into the cell. Or we will make you suffer!
FX: DOCTOR MOVES INTO CELL. CELL DOORS CLANG SHUT
Listen to me. I am your Emperor. I developed the mind exchange for you. I supervised the first tests on the colonists of the planet Telderan.
This proves nothing. The Doctor could know this.

After we tested it on the colony leader, he begged us to return him to his own body. He begged us to take his own daughter instead, to exchange her mind with that of a Dalek. His daughter’s name was Tamora.
Why are you telling me this?
Because the Doctor could not know this - because he was not there. Only the Supreme Dalek and myself were in attendance. Please. All I ask is that you verify my story.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 78
SCENE 47. INT. DAVROS’ CHAMBER.
So you’re the Doctor? The one I met before?
I am. You’re not seeing me at my best, I’m afraid.
I should've guessed. The other guy was like, well callous.
It’s not your fault. It’s not as if we spent a great deal of time together. As I recall, we were too concerned with fighting the Terravore.
You remember, then?
Of course. It was when I travelled with Evelyn.
Yeah, she was cool. What happened to her?
Evelyn? Oh, she met someone. A chap named Rossiter. She was very happy with him.
So you travel on your own now?
For the moment, yes. Why do you ask?
Just random interest, making conversation.
Your friend was brought into this time-zone too, wasn’t he? What was his name? Jared.
Yeah. We lost him in the woods.
Well, if it’s any comfort, he seems to have avoided the Dalek patrols, nor has he been recaptured by the French.
But then where is he?
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 79
SCENE 48. INT. MONT ST JEAN.
FX: DISTANT SOUNDS OF GUNFIRE, CANNON.
(AS THOUGH READING MAPS/REPORTS )
Napoleon knows we dare not make the first move, nor can we withdraw with the Forest of Soignes at our back. He has humbugged me, by God! Captain. Is there any news from Old Blucher?
No, your grace. The last report said the Prussian army had been ambushed by the French at Wavre.
Ambushed?
There’s no way they can reach us before the day is out, your grace.
Then we must win or lose this day alone. What about Hougemont?
French skirmishers have taken the woods, your grace. According to our scouts Napoleon has sent a brigade of light infantry to the secure the area.
So he intends to outflank us. Captain Dickson. Give the order to open fire on the woods with our Howitzers.
Sir, but that will give away the position of our artillery -
We have no choice! We are here for a battle, captain, so let us have a battle. Up guards and at them!
Yes, your grace.
(SEES NEW ARRIVAL) Well? What are you waiting for?
This man claims to know about the Daleks, your grace. I thought you may like to question him.
Your grace? Hey, don’t I recognise you from somewhere?
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 80
As well you should, soldier. I am the Duke of Wellington.
The Duke of Wellington! You are seriously the Duke? I’m talking to the Duke of Wellington? That is awesome. Hold on there, I’ve got to get a photo of you.
Here is my offer. Tell us what you know about the Daleks and you will be treated honourably. Refuse, and you will be executed for spying.
But you shouldn’t know about the Daleks at all.
We know they are the Emperor’s new allies. We know that two days ago the Emperor was in poor health but that ever since these Daleks appeared on the scene, he has been a changed man.
Well, I don’t know much. I know they’re aliens. And they’re armed with these things like laser guns.
Laser guns? What are they?
Like your muskets, but more powerful, more powerful even than your cannons.
I’m sorry, your grace. This man is either mocking us or insane.
Hey, I said you wouldn’t believe me. But I can tell you one thing. If Napoleon has the Daleks on his side, you are gonna get massacred.
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 81
SCENE 49. INT. DUNGEONS.
FX: CELL DOOR OPENS. SUPREME DALEK ENTERS
A visit from the Supreme Dalek. Can I assume you have realised I was telling the truth?
You will prove your identity.
Scan my brain. That will be all the proof you require.
FX: SCAN PERFORMED
Brain pattern matches that of a member of the Kaled race.
Exactly. I may have the body of a Time Lord but I have the mind of Davros.
This could still be a deception. A malfunction with the device.
You require more proof? Then tell me. Is the Doctor’s female associate still with him in the command chamber?
She is.
Then listen in on their conversation.
That is not possible. Davros has deactivated all surveillance within the command chamber.
And why do you think he did that? Listen. Give me access to the security computer, and I will be able to reactivate the surveillance.
Dalek. Give the Doctor access the security computer.
I obey.
FX: HUM OF POWER — LIKE A HOLOGRAM APPEARING
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 82
Initiate over-ride order code nine Helix five Meta zero zero Loma One.
FX: DEVICE ACTIVATES
Command chamber surveillance re-activated.
Excellent. Now. Let us hear what the Doctor is saying...
(FX: VIA A HOLOGRAM, THE DOCTOR AND FLIP SPEAKING — WHICH TAKES US INTO THE NEXT SCENE)
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 83
SCENE 50. INT. DAVROS’ CHAMBER.
FX: INITIALLY VIA THE HOLOGRAM, THEN INTO THE CHAMBER
- and that is where you were when you last saw Jared?
Yeah, I think so.
Hougemont wood. The area which is currently undergoing heavy bombardment by the British artillery.
What?
But at the time your friend went missing, that area was occupied by the British. Let us hope, for his sake, that he was captured...
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 84
SCENE 51. EXT. MONT ST JEAN.
(FX: ENGLISH ARTILLERY FIRING IN B/G. ORDERS BEING YELLED, HORSES BEING SURPRISED. )
Report, Captain Dickson!
Our artillery, sir. When French began to fire on them, they disobeyed their orders and returned fire.
The idiots! And meanwhile the French infantry continue to advance through the wood!
Woah. This is just like Command and Conquer.
FX: SUDDEN EXPLOSION, DEAFENING, CLOSE
What was that?
Napoleon’s artillery. He’s throwing the whole lot at us.
FX: ANOTHER EXPLOSION. AND MORE. DEAFENING ROAR OF CANNON
Captain! Order all our men behind the ridge, order them to lie down. Napoleon is firing blind!
FX: ANOTHER EXPLOSION, SCREAMS OF INJURED SOLDIERS
Where is that French spy?
He’s.. he’s running off sir, heading for Hougemont.
Scurrying back to his Emperor. Let him run. He won’t get far!
FX: ANOTHER EXPLOSION
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 85
SCENE 52. EXT. LA BELLE ALLIANCE.
(FX: ARTILLERY IS, IF ANYTHING, LOUDER HERE. FRENCH SOLDIERS SHOUTING ORDERS )
Emperor, it’s working. They’re wasting their artillery trying to return fire!
It is natural cowardice. The violent instinct of self- preservation! Men try to destroy their attackers in order to avoid being destroyed themselves.
But even the massed guns of the Grande Batterie will not destroy the Allied army.
Our intention is not to destroy the enemy, Marshal Ney. Our intention is to break his spirit. It is better to cause your enemy to flee in fear than to face him in battle.
But Emperor, the British have nowhere to flee to...
Exactly. They will enter into the fight with the taste of defeat in their mouths. Gentlemen, the battle is already half- won!
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 86
SCENE 53. INT. DAVROS’ CHAMBER.
Can’t you send out a Dalek patrol to rescue him or something?
Not without arousing suspicion. The Daleks must continue to believe I am Davros. I’ve already risked a great deal in preventing the Daleks from exterminating you.
Oh, right. I get it. You can’t save my boyfriend because it might blow your cover!
Flip, if the Daleks find out who I really am, both our lives would be forfeit...
(FX: DURING THIS FINAL SPEECH, WE MOVE BACK TO THE DUNGEONS, AND THE DALEKS AND THE DOCTOR LISTENING IN)
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 87
SCENE 54. INT. DUNGEON.
FX: THEY OVERHEAR THE END OF THE DOCTOR'S SPEECH. THEN:
He is the Doctor. He must be exterminated.
So, you believe me at last?
You are Davros. (BEAT) Do you wish to punish us?
You failed to recognise your own Emperor. You imprisoned me. You humiliated me. I am not inclined to forgiveness.
What is your command?
You. The Dalek that brought me here. Self-destruct.
I obey. I obey. I obey.
FX: THE DALEK IMPLODES
And as for you, Supreme Dalek. Increase neural electro- stimulation by a factor of ten for five seconds.
I obey. (SCREECHES IN AGONY FOR FIVE SECONDS)
Now you will know better than to make that mistake again!
I will order the Daleks to enter the command chamber and exterminate the Doctor and the human female.
No! Wait. Let us listen to them some more. I want to know exactly what the Doctor had planned.
FX: WHICH TAKES US INTO THE NEXT SCENE, AS THEY OVERHEAR IT
WATERLOO OF THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris Page 88
SCENE 55. INT. DAVROS CHAMBER.

DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 55. INT. DAVROS CHAMBER.
DAVROS: “Try walking a mile in another man’s shoes.” I know now what it is to be Davros. To have the mind of a genius trapped inside what is essentially a corpse.

The pain is too great, and too constant. If there was a switch on this chair, a switch that would turn off the life-support, that would bring an end to the agony, I would press that switch in an instant. I would not have the willpower to resist it.

DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 56. INT. DAVROS’ CHAMBER.
DALEK: Human designation Bonaparte has been located.

Had he defeated the British and Prussian armies at Waterloo, Napoleon would have taken the first step towards total dominance in Europe. Within a century the globe would have been under the control of the French Empire. A regime of absolute autocracy, but also of great scientific progress. At last, the human race could achieve its potential. Transformed from an enemy into a potential ally of the Daleks.
